column30: Description
Add a section in your README explaining your Git strategy, branch naming, and commit practices.

column1: Create feature branches for CI/CD and Docker
column30: Create separate branches for Jenkinsfile and Dockerfile development. Use naming conventions like feature/jenkins or feature/docker.
Decide on a branching model (e.g., main/dev/feature). Document how and when to merge, rebase, or squash commits.

column1: Set up GitHub repository for BMS
column30: Create a public or private GitHub repo for the Book-My-Show app. Initialize with a README and .gitignore.
Update EC2 security group to allow inbound traffic on Prometheus (9090) and Grafana (3000) ports.

column1: create grafana dashboard for ec2 metric
column30: Build a dashboard showing CPU, memory, disk usage, and Docker container stats. Use Prometheus queries to populate panels.
Install Grafana and configure it to connect to Prometheus as a data source. Ensure the Grafana UI is accessible via browser.
* Download and configure Prometheus on your Ubuntu EC2 instance. Set up the {{prometheus.yml}} file to scrape metrics from the host and Docker containers.

column1: configure security group for jenkins access
column30: Update the EC2 security group to allow inbound traffic on port 8080 for Jenkins and port 22 for SSH.
Install Jenkins either natively or via Docker. Open required ports and verify Jenkins UI is accessible from your public IP.
* SSH into the EC2 instance and install Docker using the official script. Verify Docker service is running and test with {{hello-world}}.
run terraform script to provision the ec2 instance

column1: wrire terraform script for ec2 provisioning
column30: * Create a Terraform {{.tf}} file to provision an Ubuntu EC2 instance with correct AMI, instance type, key pair, and security group.

column1: build and test docker image locally
Add build status badge to readme
column30: Generate a Jenkins build badge and embed it in the GitHub README to show pipeline status.
Store logs, binaries, or Docker image metadata from each Jenkins build
Set up Jenkins inside a Docker container. Install required plugins (Git, Docker, Pipeline) and verify access to the host Docker daemon.
Trivy & OWASP checks
Prometheus & Grafana dashboards
Terraform + EC2 setup
Dockerfile creation, image testing
Jenkins automation for build/test/deploy
Git setup, branching, pushing code
